|cpu1_cores = 1 |cpu1_type = MIPS 24Kc |cpu1_type_rev = |cpu1spd = 400 |is_doc = |bus = |flash1type = |fla1_num = |fla1chip = Macronix;MX25L6406EMI-12G; |flash1size = 8 |flash1maxsize = |ram1type = |ram1type1 = |ram1spd = |ram1size = 32 |ram1chip = Mira;P2S56D40GTP; |stockos = Linux;2.6.15-5.2;AirOS; |exp_if_types = USB 2.0 |exp_sim_num = |exp_pcmcia_num = |exp_expcard_num = |exp_minipci_num = |exp_minipcie_num = |exp_usb_num = 1 |exp_cf_num = |exp_sdmmc_num = |exp_ide_num = |exp_ata_num = |exp_sata_num = |exp_esata_num = |exp_parallel = |exp_sfp_num = |exp_M.2 = |exp_hdmi_num = |usb_hub = |pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 5 |pwr_amp_dc = 2 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = |pwr_barrel_inner = |pwr_barrel_len = |pwr_pol = |serial = yes,, internal,, 12-pin header,, (115200 8N1),, JP3 |jtag = |specialfeat = |flags = |addchip = |802dot11_protocols = bgn |defaulip = 192.168.1.1 |defaultlogin = ubnt |defaultpass = ubnt |defaultssid = |defaultssid_regex = |default_ch = |manuf = |manuf_model = |manuf_rev = |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = OpenWrt, DD-WRT |availability = Discontinued |eoldate = 2014 |fccapprovdate = 06/22/2010 |estreldate = |estprice = |upc = 609728683566 |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = B004EFLMAE |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |countrymanuf = |buttons = |led = |dimensions = |weight = |wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1 = Atheros;AR9285; |rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = none |rad1txchains = 1 |rad1rxchains = 1 |rad1sstreams = 1 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |rad1n = 150 |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 54 |rad1freq = 2.4 }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== The ''Ubiquiti Networks'' logo and "SIMPLE AP N" appears to be silkscreened on these boards. :"11-00124-04" and "UBIQUITI NETWORKS (C) 2010" is also etched onto the board. The wireless chip used is apparently the AR9285 [http://thread.gmane.org/gmane.linux.kernel.wireless.general/73482] [http://thread.gmane.org/gmane.linux.kernel.wireless.general/71864/focus=6526]. :There are U.FL connectors on the board, but they are not connected by default. ''UBNT'''s FCC internal photos for this device are perma-confidential. ==Links of Interest== ===Wikis=== *[http://wiki.openwrt.org/toh/ubiquiti/airrouter ''AirRouter/AirRouter-HP'' on the '''OpenWrt''' Wiki] *[http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?p=552275 On the '''DD-WRT''' Wiki] (w/ specs) :This router seems to be supported by DD-WRT, but activation is required. ===Forum threads=== *[https://forum.openwrt.org/viewtopic.php?id=34434 One thread (of several) on the '''OpenWrt''' Forums] ===Teardowns / etc=== *[http://openrouter.info/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=290:ubiquiti-airrouter&catid=41:recenzje&Itemid=55 Internal pictures at '''openrouter.info'''] ==Flashing== {{Flashnotice}} ===Flashing dd-wrt=== {{DDWRTNotice|activation}} Supported by dd-wrt as of = AirRouter build 15428 20101011 Please insert instructions here ===Flashing OpenWrt=== {{OpenWrt |techdata = https://openwrt.org/toh/hwdata/ubiquiti/ubiquiti_airrouter |wikipage = https://openwrt.org/toh/ubiquiti/airrouter |forumpage = https://forum.openwrt.org/viewtopic.php?id=34434 |forumpage2 = |forumpage3 = |github = |target = |subtarget = |arch = |support_started_version = 12.09 |current_supported_version = 22.03.5 |comment = }} Please insert instructions here ==JTAG-Serial Info== ===Serial=== ====Serial Pinouts==== The UART header would not seem to be populated on all units. 
[3.3] (   ) U
(RxD) (   ) A
(   ) (   ) R
(   ) (   ) T
(TxD) (   )
(GND) (   ) JP2

----> to screw
<---- to board edge
